channel.title: Loading cache folder for server client?
channel.description: Yeah I can't get my client to load the cache and this is important now that my client can't just use the cache from cache folder lol, can anyone help me on doing this please? :$

PaulT:

You’re trying to make your own serverclient from scratch if I understand you right?

item.source: Loading cache folder for server client?

item.title: Loading cache folder for server client?
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:4, topic:2964”][quote author=xerozcheez link=topic=3340.msg32295#msg32295 date=1147870705]

With the update of the new client, I’m thinking the cache file has also changed?

Yes it has, that’s why I need to know how to load the old cache files (like most clients), by reading from a cache folder within the directory of the client, but you see I don’t know how to do that =, I’ve removed the common traps, I’ve made it connect to localhost to get cache files, but it still doesn’t work
[/quote]
./CacheFolder/cachefile

I think you’d use that path to load it from. Now, find where it loads it from the website… And get that shit out of there. Then, look in some Aryan files and you should find out how to load files(That’s where I got the file path up there). I don’t really know what’s in the cache folder, or how it reads, but if you could supply me with that I can help you out.[/quote]

Lol I don’t get what you mean, it should load from the local directory by using ip 127.0.0.1 but it doesn’t, on real rs it downloads the cache to C:\Windows.file_store32, and reads from it, but I’m trying to read from the local directory and not connect to real rs, you probably don’t understand what I mean but for example moparscape 2.1 uses the cache folder in it’s directory, and I want my client to do the same…perhaps I might start over on a different source lolz, I made my client from a fresh 317 deob and added everything in.

Read full topic
item.source: Loading cache folder for server client?

item.title: Loading cache folder for server client?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“xerozcheez, post:3, topic:2964”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=3340.msg32293#msg32293 date=1147869825]
With the update of the new client, I’m thinking the cache file has also changed?
[/quote]

Yes it has, that’s why I need to know how to load the old cache files (like most clients), by reading from a cache folder within the directory of the client, but you see I don’t know how to do that =, I’ve removed the common traps, I’ve made it connect to localhost to get cache files, but it still doesn’t work :([/quote]
./CacheFolder/cachefile

I think you’d use that path to load it from. Now, find where it loads it from the website… And get that shit out of there. Then, look in some Aryan files and you should find out how to load files(That’s where I got the file path up there). I don’t really know what’s in the cache folder, or how it reads, but if you could supply me with that I can help you out.

Read full topic
